field.name: FRDE
field.description: FIFO Request DMA Enable\n Enables/disables DMA requests

field.name: FWDE
field.description: FIFO Warning DMA Enable\n Enables/disables DMA requests

field.name: FRIE
field.description: FIFO Request Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables FIFO request interrupts

field.name: FWIE
field.description: FIFO Warning Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables FIFO warning interrupts

field.name: FEIE
field.description: FIFO Error Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables FIFO error interrupts

field.name: SEIE
field.description: Sync Error Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables sync error interrupts

field.name: WSIE
field.description: Word Start Interrupt Enable\n Enables/disables word start interrupts

field.name: FRF
field.description: FIFO Request Flag\n Indicates that the number of words in an enabled transmit channel FIFO is less than or equal to the transmit FIFO watermark

field.name: FWF
field.description: FIFO Warning Flag\n Indicates that an enabled transmit FIFO is empty

field.name: FEF
field.description: FIFO Error Flag\n Indicates that an enabled transmit FIFO has underrun.\n Write a logic 1 to this field to clear this flag

field.name: SEF
field.description: Sync Error Flag\n Indicates that an error in the externally-generated frame sync has been detected.\n Write a logic 1 to this field to clear this flag

field.name: WSF
field.description: Word Start Flag\n Indicates that the start of the configured word has been detected.\n Write a logic 1 to this field to clear this flag

field.name: SR
field.description: Software Reset\n When set, resets the internal transmitter logic including the FIFO pointers.\n Software-visible registers are not affected, except for the status

field.name: FR
field.description: FIFO Reset\n Resets the FIFO pointers. Reading this field will always return zero

field.name: BCE
field.description:
Bit Clock Enable
 Enables the transmit bit clock, separately from the TE.
 This field is automatically set whenever TE is set. 
 When software clears this field, the transmit bit clock remains enabled, and this bit remains set, until the end of the current frame

field.name: DBGE
field.description: Debug Enable\n Enables/disables transmitter operation in Debug mode.\n The transmit bit clock is not affected by debug mode

field.name: STOPE
field.description: Stop Enable\n Configures transmitter operation in Stop mode.\n This field is ignored and the transmitter is disabled in all low-leakage stop modes

field.name: TE
field.description: Transmitter Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter enabled\tor transmitter has been disabled and has not yet reached end of frame

field.name: TFW
field.description: Transmit FIFO Watermark\n Configures the watermark level for all enabled transmit channels

field.name: DIV
field.description: Bit Clock Divide\n Divides down the audio master clock to generate the bit clock when configured for an internal bit clock.\n The division value is (DIV + 1) * 2

field.name: BCD
field.description: Bit Clock Direction\n Configures the direction of the bit clock

field.name: BCP
field.description: Bit Clock Polarity\n Configures the polarity of the bit clock

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Active high\t- Bit clock drives outputs on rising edge and samples inputs on falling edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Active Low\t- Bit clock drives outputs on falling edge and samples inputs on rising edge

field.name: MSEL
field.description: Clocking mode\n When configured for external bit clock configures for asynchronous or synchronous operation. When configured for internal bit clock, selects the Audio Master Clock used to generate the internal bit clock

field.name: BCI
field.description: Bit Clock Input

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Internal logic is clocked as if bit clock was externally generated

field.name: BCS
field.description: Bit Clock Swap

field.name: SYNC
field.description: Synchronous Mode

field.name: WDFL
field.description: Word Flag Configuration Configures which word sets the start of word flag.\n The value written must be one less than the word number.\n For example, writing 0 configures the first word in the frame

field.name: TCE
field.description: Transmit Channel Enable\n Enables the corresponding data channel for transmit operation.\n A channel must be enabled before its FIFO is accessed

field.name: FSD
field.description: Frame Sync Direction\n Configures the direction of the frame sync

field.name: FSP
field.description: Frame Sync Polarity\n Configures the polarity of the frame sync

field.name: FSE
field.description: Frame Sync Early\n Control where frame sync asserts relative to 1st bit of the frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Asserts one bit before first bit

field.name: MF
field.description: MSB First\n Configures whether the LSB or the MSB is transmitted/received first

field.name: SYWD
field.description:
Sync Width
 Configures the length of the frame sync in number of bit clocks.
 The value written must be one less than the number of bit clocks.
 or example, write 0 for the frame sync to assert for one bit clock only

field.name: FRSZ
field.description:
Frame size
 Configures the number of words in each frame.
 The value written must be one less than the number of words in the frame.
 For example, write 0 for one word per frame

field.name: FBT
field.description:
First Bit Shifted
 Configures the bit index for the first bit transmitted for each word in the frame.
 If configured for MSB First, the index of the next bit transmitted is one less than the current bit transmitted.
 If configured for LSB First, the index of the next bit transmitted is one more than the current bit transmitted

field.name: W0W
field.description:
Word 0 Width
 Configures the number of bits in the first word in each frame.
 The value written must be one less than the number of bits in the first word.
 Word width of less than 8 bits is not supported if there is only one word per frame

field.name: WNW
field.description:
Word N Width
 Configures the number of bits in each word, for each word except the first in the frame.
 The value written must be one less than the number of bits per word.
 The value of WNW must be greater than or equal to the value of W0W even when there is only one word in each frame.
 Word width of less than 8 bits is not supported

register.name: TDR%s
register.description:
Transmit Data Register
 The corresponding TCR3[TCE] bit must be set before accessing the channel's transmit data register.
 Writes to this register when the transmit FIFO is not full will push the data written into the transmit data FIFO.
 Writes to this register when the transmit FIFO is full are ignored

field.description: Transmit Data Register

field.description: Write FIFO Pointer\n FIFO write pointer for transmit data channel

field.description: Transmit Word Mask\n Configures whether the transmit word is masked (transmit data pin tri-stated and \n transmit data not read from FIFO) for the corresponding word in the frame

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Word N is masked\t- The transmit data pins are tri-stated when masked
